humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that metastatic adenocarcinoma consistent with breast origin is identified in 4 of 16 axillary lymph nodes (AJCC pN2), which corresponds to N2 stage according to Rule 14 and New Rule 12. The other rules do not apply to this report.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the presence and extent of cancer involvement in the lymph nodes. In this report, metastatic adenocarcinoma consistent with breast origin is identified in multiple (4 out of 16) axillary lymph nodes, with the largest metastatically involved node measuring 3.0 cm in maximum dimension and showing extracapsular tumor extension. This information corresponds to AJCC pN2, which indicates that the cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes and/or has cancer in axillary lymph nodes and in the lymph nodes near the breastbone.
